column9: Matches style and quality of iPhone 5S!
column10: This is a great case for 5S!  Looks and fits great!  Now I can stop worrying about dropping the phone :)

After all the cases I've tried, from the ringke slim, belkin, case crown, speck, incipio to the otterbox defender and commuter. This case is truly the best of both worlds. It's a perfect blend of protection and sleekness.It's perfectly engineered with all of the pass throughs aligning perfectly with what needs to be accessed on the phone. The vibrate switch, headphone jack, camera, microphone, speaker and lightning port. The flat case with buttons are absolutely fantastic and the beveled edges make the phone easy to grip while still maintaining a confortable grip.The rubber Spigen chose is absolutely perfect, it's firm without being too soft or prone to stretching like the otterbox.Give it a try, my guess is that you will like it as much as I do. Especially if your looking for something between minimal like the ringke slim and the otterbox series.
It is very nice,  I like so much....., It fit my Iphone 5 and make it save and looks good.Thanks Amazon....

I originally for had a protective case for my iPhone 5.  It was nice but it felt and looked pretty terrible.  I then got a "sleek" case.  It looked really nice but it provided absolutely no protection.  I actually ended up dropping it and breaking the screen.  It cost me $150 to replace.I upgraded to to iPhone 5s and I was looking for a case that could provide a combination of both a great look and sufficient protection.  After a long search, I found this case.  This is not only one of the best looking cases that I have seen, it is also one of the most protective ones.  You get Otterbox protection without the 4x size of the phone.  I cannot recommend this case more.I have read some reviews that say it is slippery or that it scratches easily.  i have not experienced either of those problems.  The Metal Slate Color is basically an identical color to the black (or whatever they are calling it now) iPhone.You will not be disappointed.

column9: Nice case but not for the current asking price
column10: This a nice slim case.  I purchased it to use with an iPhone 5s.  I believe it will off good protection for the iPhone but of course I have intentionally dropped it to get that theory!  The Apple cord plugs in easily.  The buttons can easily be pressed.  Pictures seem to be unaffected by the case but I've only taken a couple.  I have a gray (black) iPhone 5s and the color of the case fits well with it.When I purchased this case I also purchased three of the following cases for myself and friends:Acase iPhone 5s / 5 case - Superleggera PRO Dual Layer Protection caseI purchased several cases because it makes sense to get a good one for a $600+ phone.The Acase is $8, the Spigen case is $24 as I write this.  I paid half price for the Spigen case due to a very short term special price.The Spigen case is very slightly better than the Acase but it's close to a tossup.  I would still get the Spigen case for $12 but I would get the Acase instead for $8 if the Spigen case were at its current $24 price.  I dropped the rating for the Spigen one point based on its price level.I had an Acase, which was of a slightly different design from the current model, for my iPhone 4s.  I dropped the 4s several times on concrete and it survived without any problems.
Great, thin case for iPhone. Works with 5s and is not bulky like otterbox cases. highly recommended product to get

Read some reviews of this Spigen SGP Tough Armor case, and went back and fourth hunting for a new case for my iPhone 5S smartphone.  Saw a positive YouTube video as well, and settled on this case over many others.  Like the design, and color (Silver) so I  purchased it.  Arrived sooner than expected, easy to put on, and peace of mind my smartphone will have some protection.  Only had it on three days now, along with a screen protector, and I hope I never drop it to test it out, but I'm happy with it.

Great case for Iphone 5S, I switched from Iphone 4S to 5S. It fit really good and there is plenty of room for the Home/Touch ID button, which I was concerned. Case also leaves room for new flash. I was an Otterbox customer but this case changed my preferences, even that I bought the Tough Armor Case it feels thinner that the Otterbox Commuter Case used on the 4S. I know Iphone 4S was thicker than actual phone, but still feels really good. As complement I bought the Spigen Crystal screen protector and is a plus protecting frame with the Armor case and screen, no interference between case edge and screen protector (If you decided to use it, I will suggest to start from bottom home/touch ID toward the top), need to be extremely careful when placing screen protector, but works great.

Before the iPhone 5S was released I started doing research on what case I wanted for my phone when I upgraded.  I always kept my iPhone 4 in an Otterbox Defender, but I grew tired of the how bulky the case was.  I came across the Tough Armor and read some great reviews.  Thus far I have been very pleased with the case.  I recently dropped the phone on one of the corners and the Tough Armor did an excellent job of keeping my phone safe.  Also the case is very thin, I barely notice it's there.  But it definitely does it's job!

I have had the Otterbox before, but it was too bulky. The new Spigen is much better, lighter and thinner. Dust and dirt can still get in at the bottom and back where there are openings, but it looks good and its all I need in a phone. Already dropped it once from about 5 feet off the ground onto a hard floor  and no damage at all. I will continue to use Spigen products, no more Otterbox for me.

I used an Otterbox commuter case on my iPhone 4 and considered that to be my favorite.  Now my favorite case is the Spigen Tough Armor.  It fits the iPhone 5s perfectly and I think will protect it quite well.

After reading many reviews I decided to order this case for my phone (had otterbox commuter). The case is feels/looks nice and phone fits snug, however the only issue I have is the thin strip on the front bottom part of the case as it flexes easily bends away from the case. Time will tell if it causes an issueUpdate 10/1/13The back part of the case is VERY soft plastic and scratches/gouges very easily (don't put your keys and phone in the same pocket). The price spent for this case I would expect a little better materialAND to make things worse I posted a 3 star average review on Spigen's site and it never got posted! So much for honesty...

I bought this one along with the slim version. This one is $28 the slim $7. This version is a gross waste of money offering little more than the $7 version and I advise NOT to buy it. I could see for its slightly strengthened frame a price upcharge of say $5. But not $21.I probably will return this to Amazon because it is so overpriced for what it is.

Just got my iPhone 5s and was looking forward to getting a new case on this bad boy as soon as possible. After reading reviews and looking at multiple models I chose Spigen SGP10490 Tough Armor Case. Great solid build quality. My aftermarket headphone plug in the bottom fine. Nice feel while holding. The slight rubbery feel of the top and bottom work well. While the back is plastic, it almost looks like and iPhone metallic  case. The fit and feel is very tight, perfect fit! The hole in the back that highlights the apple logo is a nice spot for a finger to rest while holding with one hand. No slippage here. I'm glad I returned the Otterbox case.
Very nice case. I love it. This is way better than the otterbox. Thank you for sending the case this quick :D

column9: Rugged,and still slim, fits flush on both sides to use as level
column10: Most cases like this will not fit evenly since the volume buttons are round, but this case has flush mounted , square volume controls.Even the top power button has flush mounted button, so it doesnt catch on anything.This also prevents dust and moisture from corroding the power button.moisture and dirt in the power button has been known to cause the power button to stop working.So this is the best balance of a case that protects but still allows you to easily slide it into your pocket and doesnt add bulk.Plus you can still use the new level function in IOS 7.

I just unboxed my Spigen case and am already in love with it.  I used an Otterbox case for my Iphone 4 and it was excellent at protecting my device, but it was HUGE and bulky. I got rid of it finally and bought a Belkin case, which annoyed me because it pushed on the screen protector and ruined 3 of them.  For my new 5S I did not want to bulk it up with the OB, so I figured I would try the Spigen case... I could not be more satisfied.  It stops just at the edge of my Tech Armor screen protector, so it doesn't interfere with that.  It is a sturdy well built case but not to bulky in anyway, shape or form.  For the price and the product you cannot go wrong with this case!!!

column9: The Case You Want For Your iPhone 5s
column10: I've been a long-time Otterbox fan, but after having to replace the outer plastic on my Commuter case several times and having the inside silicone stretch at the phone's corners over time, I decided to give something else a try. Picked up this case based on the reviews, and I'm so glad I did. The fit is outstanding, and the case almost looks like part of the phone. It appears to be designed to flow right into the designed lines of the iPhone - even the back of the case has the same look as the back of the phone. After seeing it, both my girlfriend and my brother are buying this case for their phones. Get it, you won't be disappointed!

Admittedly it is difficult to write a compelling review of a phone case until it has been thoroughly tested.  My phone hasn't been dropped or anything since I received this case, but the case looks and feels great, and it seems sturdy and well built.  I read almost every single Amazon review before purchasing, and all of the issues that others pointed out are minor and overblown.  The phone isn't so sleek that it will slide off every surface, and the lip around the front edges is just enough to protect the face of the device and no more.If you're looking for a great looking case that offers Otterbox-like protection without the bulk, this is it.  5 stars.

I never write reviews for products but this case is great. If you read reviews on cases and not sure what to get, this is the one. It provides a great amount of protection and still slim enough where it is not bulky like an otter box. I only had it for a few days but feels very sturdy and think it will hold up for a long time. If in need of a case, this is it
Whats not to love. Its durable keeps the the slimp sleek design of the phone and matchs the phone perfectly.

Love the slim design yet great protection.  Everything is easily accessible; buttons are very responsive.  It looks and feels great.  The back does scratch somewhat easily but better the case than the phone.  I also did order black and received Metal Slate, but it still looks pretty sexy.  Other than those 2 little things, definitely 5 stars.  Also, the camera lens / flash work fine with the iPhone 5s.  Thanks Spigen!

column9: Best durable yet sleek case? Definately!
column10: I've tried out all kinds of cases from bumpers to tanky cases. I like the simplicity of bumper cases but I hate how much of a risk you put your phone at if you ever make a mistake handling it. Tanky cases such as the otterbox defender is nice and durable but it leaves you somewhat wanting to use your phone less. It pretty much makes it a hassle. Then if your somewhat OCD as me (paying $20-$40 for a case and not expecting quality), it can be annoying buying cases such as a TPU (techarmor/diztronic) case and having it stretch out over 2-5 months. I've been using the acase dual pro for a while until I saw this.Yes this case is a 2 part but the black part DOES NOT stretch out which I find to be amazing. It's some sort of a hard smooth material which seems to have NO manufacturing defects or anything. The hard solid part is smooth. Not sure how to describe.ProsDurableEasy to press buttonsNice lip on the frontCompatible with glass screen protectorsConsThe silver hard back seems to scratch up against keys and sorts leaving small scratch marks.

Picked this up due to the great reviews, and while I partially agree with nearly all of them, the item fell a bit short of my expectations.It looks really nice, and fits the phone snug, with well designed buttons, which of course are good things.  I'm a bit leery of the protection claims... the rubber/plastic inner layer seems like it could be slightly thicker; I'm not however, doing to purposely drop my phone to test it out.  It still feels/looks like it offers more protection than lesser cases.My issue is the hard backing that you snap on after putting on the softer case.  The backing looks classy and looks like metal, but it's very slippery.  I'm uneasy holding my phone in certain environments because the back of the case makes me think the phone is going to slip out of my hands, sometimes.  I wonder why someone would build a case that's suppose to offer protection, yet make the back of it so slippery that it increases your risk of actually dropping the phone (??); they need in my opinion, to add a slight texture to the hard backing for better grip.I'm sure they have other items in their line that would better suit my phone if I get around to researching it.  For me, this one just doesn't seem like 'it'.

I'm using this case on a Space Gray 5S, and I opted for the Metal Slate.  The case looks absolutely fantastic and doesn't add much heft to the phone.  That doesn't mean that the protection suffers for it.  The case feels absolutely solid and definitely help alleviate any fear of damaging my new phone.  Highly recommended.

I was pleased with the cover right out of the box. Nice feel to it. No soft rubber jelly. Nice firm and holds it's shape, while surrounded another harder cover. Snug to the phone and don’t have any extra that takes away from the phones look and size. I never used the Outer Box product because of its size. This cover is perfect!!!!!!! I'm not telling anyone to get one, buy two you want be disappointed

This case is a quality case. It doesn't move inside the case. It doesn't peel like an otter box, its more sturdy than an odder box in my opinion. Its worth well over the price on amazon. Haven't dropped it yet so i cant say anything about that.  Amazing you wont be disappointing!!!

So I got this case to replace my Otterbox defender.  I have used a defender for years,  once on an old android,  again on my iphone 4, then again on my Iphone 5.  I wanted to try the tough armor because I wanted a thinner case AND I wanted to enjoy the screen.  You cannot do that with the defender.  The glare, and their protector takes away from the screen I feel.  This case is good.  I take care of it.  When it's in my pocket it's the only thing in my pocket.  I have taken notice, I GENTLY put it on a counter, and it has scratched the back.  ALOT.  other than that, thats the only issue.UPDATE:I ordered this case and have had it since about the start of September.  I take care of my phone.  The back of the case is scratched ALOT, to the point where it looks like whatever they use to make the case 'slate' is wearing.  It looks worn.Another issue which I just emailed SGP about, is it messes with the sleep button recently.  I have to press HARD to get the sleep/wake button to work.  Take the case off, button works fine.  Put the case on another Iphone 5, same issue
Great feel the phone with the case on. Feels like you're holding the actual phone without a case. Good protection for my needs, since I'm not one to always be dropping my phone.
Drop my phone a few times and the case has protected the phone. Definitely would recommend. Case does get scratch but better that then the phone.

column9: This is more of a comment than a review
column10: I'm debating between Lifeproof and this case, and haven't purchased this case yet, but I wanted to leave a quick comment to say that it looks like a well thought-out case which seems like it would protect it as long as it's needed(next year's and the following phone won't likely work with this case). On top of that, since the camera/flash part of the phone and the home button are so different from the previous iPhones, I love that the picture shown is not only clear, but showcases those major features. Nicely done, SPIGEN! :-)
Looks great and sturdy enough to protect your iPhone from drops.  Protection without the bulk that you would get with, say, an Otterbox.
The Spigen is a great case.  It's really sturdy and not bulky, which is always the problem I have with the Otter cases.  And it looks great too. Feels good in your hand.
I am really happy with ALL my new Spigen products.  I like the slim design and all the color choices.  I do wish they offered a pink cover, though.  I highly recommend this product.

I am very impressed with this case. It is exactly what I was hoping for, sleek, modern and protective. I have yet to drop the phone so I havent tested it yet, but I suspect it will survive all but a blunt drop to the front glass. I did not buy a protective film so I am taking a few chances. Time will tell how well it performs.

Looks cool, fits great, and protects. It's not even that thick or heavy. I have the glas tr on and the lip is just right. I just wish there was a way to take off the old jelly button so I could put on the new one, but soon enough I'll be buying the nano slim and aluminum home buttons.Update: I forgot to mention, they sent me a free oleophobic front and back protector. After using this case for a little I found a scratch on the back. It's not like I look at the back much, no big deal. But just a few minutes ago I put it down on my drawers and used the leveling thing in ios 7 and moved it around a little. I found a few more scratches. The back scratches too easily, but thats what its for.

This case is sturdy and allows you to easily press the buttons on the sides. The only minus is that the silver surface quickly gets a somewhat worn look with tiny scratches, and this is after just a few weeks. Apart from that it looks sleek and classy.
really is very good, high quality, well made. port openings are large enough, button push easily. finally a great case.

column9: Great case - but adapter does not fit
column10: Best case in terms of fit, quality and aesthetics.  I love this case!  I've had a few Spiegen's but this one is relatively the thinnest for the amount of protection.  It does NOT fit the charger adaptor into the port. This is the 10 pin adaptor...just surprised they did not think of it.  So I have to take my case off when charging using the adaptor. Annoying. Bad planning.
Fits nice and tight (that's what she said)! Extra protection without all the extra bulk. I'd defiantly recommend this one.
I love the case and so far it appears to be holding up good.  Thank you for this very nice case!

column9: Best case I've had so far
column10: Case fits great without bulkiness other cases have. The larger buttons make it easier to operate the phone also. Highly recommend.
The From the excellent choice with a slim design. I am a long time Otterbox user so I am holding final judgement until I drop my phone for the first time.

It's great for work when I keep it in a holster, but also will easily slide in my pocket on the weekend. I paired it with one of Spigen's glass screen protectors and they work together perfectly. I highly recommend this product!

A nice upgrade from their SlimArmor cases.  I like the ability to place it face down and not be laying on the screen.  As always, great look, fit and finish.

I have been using this case for a few days now and absolutely love it.  It doesn't add much bulk to the phone, while offering great protection.  It is a very simple design that is easy to assemble.  Because most of the materials are rigid and smooth, it slides in and out of your pockets with no issues.  I have full access to all of the ports, which has been an issue with other cases.I would recommend this product to anyone that wants a simple, yet tough case for their phones without adding extensive bulk.

Slick case that looks good and feels good to hold.  Easy to install as well.  Supposedly this new generation is not as slim as previous versions, but it definitely feels like it will protect my phone in a fall.

I ordered the Satin Silver one and the Aluminum home button pack with the black, silver, and pink for my white IPhone 5 and my phone looks amazing! This case is extremely comfortable in hand and lightweight as well as protective. I'm using the black home button and the contrast between that and case and phone is a great combo! Definitely give this product 5 stars
First impressions: Quality feel. Easy on. Sleek and looks very close to a naked iPhone. Time will tell how durable and if the looks hold up.  So far very pleased on day 1.
Fits my iPhone 5 perfect! Feels premium and offers great protection! Super slim and for the price it can't be beat! Love it! Will continue to buy from SPIGEN!

I own numerous cases for the iPhone 5 but this case might be my last one. The case fits the iPhone perfectly and adds a very sleek look to it while providing a substantial amount of protection. I love the way the buttons feel and the cut outs at the bottom are perfect. The case fits the phone nice and snug yet is still easy to remove if need be. All my friends that have seen the case have commented on how nice it looks and I wasn't even trying to show it off. The material the case is made of seems like it will last a long time and is very durable. I own about a dozen cases and this one by far is the best one, it looks great and I am very confident that if I drop my phone it will protect it. There is a nice lip around the screen for added protection to the screen. In the event the phone falls on a flat surface you can rest easy knowing your screen is safe. Since the lip around the screen causes the screen to be recessed Spigen provided home screen buttons along with the case. Overall I have no complaints about the case and plan to order another one!*UPDATE*Unfortunately my phone was knocked out of my hand and was popped up very high in the air and fell on concrete. However I am pleased to report that absolutely NO DAMAGE happened to the phone whatsoever!!!! The case got a few scratches and dings of course but when I removed the case to inspect the phone everything still looked good as new!!!! Great Job Spigen!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Pros:-Looks cool-quality materials and construction-fits well-adds minimal weight/bulk for the protection it offers-recessed power button may prevent me from hanging up on people inadvertentlyCONS:-Very uncomfortable in hand due to sharp edges and corners and hard material (the black part isn't rubbery) and where there is a sharp edge where aluminum piece meets plastic-offers little improvement over the iPhone 5's near-zero coefficient of friction (i.e. it's just about as slippery). The satin finish aluminum feels very much like the iPhone itself which might be viewed as a plus were it not for the fact that the black part is more akin to hard plastic than rubber or silicone.Summary: sharp edges and slipperiness aside it's a nice looking, well-constructed case.

column9: Slim, clean look with smooth, well fitted, harder surface
column10: I purchased this in white and it is very clean and crisp looking, just like my iPhone 5, which is a look I wanted to preserve..  The top and bottom ends are just a little more matte feeling than the body, which is smooth but not shiny.  This is not a rubberized texture, so it would likely slide on a dashboard--it has a harder feel, but seems well protected.  Some might like a more comfort grip in the hand -- and this is more firm than that, but it is not sharp-edged like the phone is without a cover.  I like how my pretty Apple mirror logo shows through the hole in the back.  This looks expensive and classy and is still very slim.  All the controls and openings are just fine with my iPhone 5.  What remains is how it will weather dirt, etc., which is always tricky with white.  After being disappointed with a Belkin rubberized white which turned gray within about 2 weeks, I will update on this.  For now at least, I would say that this case is clearly better quality and better-made than cheaper cases--and I am pleased with my purchase.

I am so pleased to have found SPIGEN cases!  I have purchased both the Slim Armor series and this one and am very impressed with the quality and craftsmanship.  I have tried cases from all of the top dealers and SPIGEN makes some of the most beautiful and high quality cases I have used.  This Tough Armor case is the best case I have found for great protection, looks and it still manages to be lightweight and slim.  If you have been discouraged in the past like I have by bulky OtterBox style alternatives; don't hesitate and get this case!  You won't be disappointed!

I already have the Spigen Slim Armor (very similar to this Tough Armor) that I bought recently.  Although I love the Slim Armor, I have had a hard time finding third party lightning accessories that work well with it.  Tough Armor's cutouts are large enough that I can use the built-in lightning cable on my Photive iPhone 5 Portable Battery Charger.In addition, I love the changes such as the cutout for the Apple logo and the new button designs.  Slim Armor is great, but if you're looking for a bit more protection, and larger port cutouts, Tough Armor is the one to get!

Got my case yesterday.  I love it.  It offers great protection with a sleek look, much slimmer than the OtterBox.  My only concern so far is that the piece below the home button (above the power port) is a little flimsy since it has to be so small.  I just hope it doesn't stretch more over time.

I've been looking for the right iPhone 5 case and this is IT! FINALLY! Love the design, the look, how snug it is, and the awesome lay-on-table design without sacrificing the slimness. Best. Case. Ever.
They don't cover non-receipt of deliveries!  USPS didn't deliver and Spigen says its your loss not ours!  That's a loss of a case and a screen protector.

Spigen, way to hit a home run. I have been a faithful Otterbox case user for sometime. When I saw this on Amazon while searching through literally hundreds of cases, this one sang to me. I received my Spigen Tough Armor case today in the mail. Unexpectedly, the stick-on home buttons and screen protectors were a bonus. Well packaged and well received. Ship time was quick considering and excluding the known wait time of the advertised release date. Now to the case.Great job with keeping it slim. I have had Defender and Commuter cases alike, and this is wailing on them. The case is very nice in the hand, not overbearing, and keeps the iPhone slim like its supposed to be. The face is opened up like it's not in a case, yet the lip keeps a bumper extended far enough out to lay it on its face. The interchangeable plate on the back is a nice touch for added protection. Also, I immediately checked the piece that connects between the home button and battery charge (a known breaking point on iPhone cases), good job. Thick yet pliable to flex.I will not be test dropping this on purpose as I am not that dedicated to jack up my phone. I do trust that the air pocket design you have designed on the corners will work. Otterbox has a serious design flaw in their rubber 1st layer. My Commuter I WAS using was starting to expand. The battery and flap wouldn't stay closed, and drove me crazy. I would rather not have it, if it were going to fail. The internal crisscross design and material you have used will surely stand up under age. The buttons are flawless. Power, volume up and down work so well.I am the guy that spends hours researching, reading reviews, and watching videos before buying. Spigen, this is why I am writing a full evaluation. I am not a review writing person, I don't have time. However, I have made time to tell others, ditch the junk from Otterbox and check this sleek, sturdy, well-designed case out. Albeit this is brand new, and I promise if I have to eat my words I WILL be back and retract my previous assessment, I think I am going to be A-OK with this case.You have a new customer Spigen. I take my brand dedication very serious. I hope you take your customer service equally. I foresee many more coming to you.

First of all lemme say right outta the box; Spigen is the fastest shipper on the planet! I ordered July 31st and got the case today August 2nd; even though the shipping date said Aug 10-15th! I've had 4 cases for my iPhone 5 and this Tough Armor is the best ever. It will replace my beloved Slim Armor by the same company. The Tough Armor has a less slippery feel than the Slim, has better access to the vibrate button and a lip around the faceplate to allow face down on the counter mode if you like that. I am sooo happy to finally find the perfect case for my iPhone (shows the Apple on the back as well). You got a customer for life Spigen (and Amazon:)

Although it's called the Tough Armor, I'd like to refer to it as the Spigen Slim Armor Plus, well basically. It follows the same design as the Slim Armor and Slim Armor S, but adds a hole for the Apple to shine through and extra TPU on the sides. There is also a large lip so you can set it face down on a table or something (or put on Spigen aluminum buttons and not have it 'Siri' when you set it down). Unlike the 'muh' look of the Otterboxy (see what I did there?) this one is sleek and provides decent protection. The buttons though (volume and pwr) are square and might need a small amount of more pressure to use; not a big concern.This is a great choice if you're looking for a tough-ish, modern looking case and not something with an ugly logo that's shaped like a box.

column9: Just what I've been waiting for from Spigen
column10: I have a lot of cell phone cases for my iphone 5.I love this case.The fit is normal Spigen.  Fits perfect. I like the way the case fits the front of the phone perfectly.  It doesn't cover the screen at all but covers right up to the edge of it.  It covers the thin metal lip that surrounds the screen.This is 2 pieces and it does come apart, but I don't find I need to take it apart to put it on or take it off. The phone is easy to install and remove.The front lip they are touting for this product is nice reassurance that if i drop it face first it wont hit the screen.  Its hot as huge compared to some other brands but I think it'll work fine.  Because they way spigen makes their cases it doesn't really bug me to much when I have to use the edge of the screen.The openings on the bottom of the phone are nicely done. Speaker ports are wide open, charge port is large, headphone jack looks like its easy to access.  The camera/flash opening is nice and large, and you get an opening for the apple logo, sweet...Even the opening for the vibrate switch is easy to use.  The opening seams better than the first version of the slim armor case.Now the buttons look like they would be a pain in the ass.  This is not the case. I was surprised to find how responsive the buttons remained given the way this case looks.  Kudos to spigen design on these buttons. All though its not like having your phone w/o a case, the buttons on this case work way better than other 'box designs'.The volume buttons seam to maintain more of the click than the power button, but the power button is still very easy to press.Overall great case.  It does at a little bulk to your phone but way way less than others that they say they compete against.  The materials feel like top notch normal spigen quality.

column9: The absolute best Iphone phone case!
column10: This is the best case I've had for my Iphone. I'd never heard of the Spigen brand before a coworker ordered one for his new 5S from Amazon. He told me he looked for the one based on the best reviews. After looking his over I couldn't agree more and ordered one for mine. It's very durable without adding much to the overall size of the phone and fits perfectly.  The square size matching the profile of the phone helps to maintain grip on the phone. The only change I'd like to see is a larger headphone jack port, but I can see how it could be done without compromising the protection.
Great case! Minimal design that protects your phone while not being bulky. I have dropped mine on concrete floors and had no problem!
This is exactly what I was looking for. Slim and tough. Fits in my pocket without bulk and looks nice with great protection.

Great case for the money. Protects the phone all around and is raised in the front to give you a little cushion between the floor and your phone screen incase it happens to land face down if you drop it. Corners are like a rubberized plastic material that is great for absorbing shock but does not inhibit its ability to slide in and out of your pocket easily. I pull my phone in and out of my pocket more times in a day then i care to think about and it does not snag at all. Provides the great protection i need because i also drop my phone a lot during the day. Ive gone through phone cases in weeks this one has lasted months now without hitch and is not nearly as bulky or ugly as those otterbox cases.

The case looks great, its slim and the color scheme is awesome. Fits my phone well. Very thin. I dropped my phone onto my tile kitchen floor and no part of my actual phone made contact with the floor. It just bounced lightly with no trouble.

column9: Protects phone very well yet shows scruffs really easy....
column10: I like the design and looks of it. Phone fits snug inside the case and makes the phone feel protected. It is a case that really protects your phone. It is so easy to install and take off it is not like other phone cases that are really hard to take off. Just recently i dropped my phone and thank god i had this case on. Nothing happen to my phone i was so happy. I definitely recommend.
Great protection, slim and sleek. Haven't had any problems with the case. Perfect for every day usage. Very highly recommend.
Good solid case. Lightweight and not as bulky as OtterBox. Seems like it will protect from just about any impact. Does get some scratches on back but very minor.  Much cheaper than OtterBox.

column9: Matches the style and color of the iPhone 5S
column10: Looks very nice - matches the style and color of the "Space Grey" iPhone 5S very well. Doesn't add a lot of bulk or weight to the phone while providing decent protection. Only about 1-mm extends from the edges to protect the face of the phone. Hard to improve on that without adding bulk though.  I'd buy it again for sure.

I have the silver iPhone 5S (with the white front) and it looks fantastic with the phone!Buttons: The buttons on this case work like a dream.  I actually thing they are easier to press than the bottons on the phone WITHOUT the case!  This is quite the difference from case on my prior phone.Protection: It seems to protect the phone well!  It has enough of a lip over the screen to help protect the screen but not enough to make it uncomfortable.  I actually dropped the phone on my tile floor and no damage so I'm pleased.Grip: The grip on the phone is average but its a good medium between a softer case and a hard shell case with the black lining being slightly softer than the hard-shelled silver backing.Cons:Pretty much the only bad thing I've discovered so far is that the silver backing SCRATCHES.  So my pretty case has a few blemishes now but still looks good!Overall: I do like this case.  It still looks great even with a few scratches (better on the case than the phone!) and it seems to offer good protection.  I would recommend it!

I have 3 Spigen cases the Tough Armor, Slim Armor S, and the Neo Hybrid. All three are really good cases offering different degrees of protection. Tough Armor offers the greatest protection and this is the case I use for work. I work construction and my phone tends to get knocked around a bit. I've been using Spigen cases for over three years and they haven't let me down. They are thin, protect well and don't add much bulk to the phone. All three fit well and look good, quality products. Just make sure you buy from Spigen or Amazon, (Sold by Spigen, fulfilled by Amazon).Bought a Tough Armor on another site and it was counterfeit. Looked good but poor fit, slipped on one side of phone. Haven't had any scratching issues yet, but I've only had it about 6 weeks.

column9: Spigen the only case you will ever want to get for your iPhone 5s or another phone for that matter!!!!

I am a disabled veteran and I have dropped my phone several times in the past and broken the screen on other phones or had to have bulky cases like the Otterbox that caused my phone to overheat and felt uncomfortable when i had to put it in my pocket and use my wheelchair. But this case rocks!! i have dropped my phone several times and no damage to my iPhone 5s whatsoever!!! The case is perfect for people who drop their phones are worried about dropping their phones. Just make sure you get the premium glass screen protector that Spigen's offers or if they are out of stock like they were when I got mine I went to my AT&T store and paid a higher premium for the same thing that Spigens provides. column9: Sleek, durable and handsome case to protect your new iPhone

They feel great initially, but the minute it slips out of your hand or slowly slides off your jeans when you set it on your leg, you'll wish for a slightly grippier surface.Finding a case that provides adequate protection (especially of the screen) while not defeating the slim and light design of the iPhone is hard. I've had good luck with the OtterBox Impact case (though all of their others are far too heavy, bulky and annoying to deal with). Unfortunately there isn't an Impact case out for the iPhone 5s yet.After searching for awhile, I was able to find a case that I thought was comparable. We ordered two of these Spigen cases hoping they would work well. I was pleasantly surprised when they arrived, and I find it much better than the Impact case. It is slim, light, has a lip on the front to protect the screen when dropped, provides just enough grip, and looks very handsome on the iPhone (both space grey and silver). The buttons all work perfectly, and align properly. They feel very responsive and clicky. It definitely feels very nice.My only gripe with the case is that, like most iPhone cases, it provides limited access to the headphone port. It works fine for the included EarPods and other slim headphone cables (Radio Shack sells cables that fit, that's where we went) -- but bulkier cables (like those found on high end headphones and many car aux input cables) don't fit. For this reason I give this case 4 stars instead of 5.Overall we are very happy with the design and quality of the cases.

column9: This case IS/IS NOT for you if...
column10: This case is for you if...You want the maximum amount of protection with the least amount of size.You want to be able to lay the phone face down bc there is a lip around the front.You want to put a screen protector on your phone w/o it getting damaged.You want a case that doesn't interfere with the camera flash.This case is NOT for you if...You can't stand scratches on your case bc the aluminum backing scratches very easily.You want a smooth feeling case bc there are some edges to this case.FYI...you do not receive anything extra with this case.  This case is a full TPU case with a indention on the back body of the case for the aluminum type backing. It seems like a insert that you can pop off, but once on the phone in, it is set and won't come off.  Where that backing meets the TPU on the side, it is not flush and you can feel a edge which may bother some people This case does add a noticeable amount of size to the phone compared to a snap back case but what you gain in size you also gain in protection. This case is great!Earlier last week I decided to order the Spigen Tough Armor case for my iPhone 5. In this reviewer's experience, the Spigen Tough Armor case is the best case available. Spigen has struck the perfect balance between bulk and protection.The Tough Armor seems slightly smaller than the Otterbox Commuter, but it does not appear to provide any less protection. The buttons are wonderfully easy to press (something that Otterbox and others always failed to achieve); they provide a nice solid "click" without requiring much force. The mute/volume switch is very easy to access – even easier than Spigen's Slim Armor case. The cutouts at the bottom of the phone are large enough to accommodate my Belkin Lightning cable. The case has a nice soft finish so that the phone will not slip out of your hands easily (unlike Spigen's Slim Armor), but it does not get stuck in pockets or collect excessive lint. In fact, the case is simply a joy to touch. (It reminds me of my old "Sharkskin" controllers for my Playstation 1.)I have always been picky about my phone cases. I am the iPhone user who hates bulk; I think it's a shame that a beautiful piece of streamlined technology has to be hidden in a case twice the phone's size. I also hate cases that provide no protection for your investment. Spigen has struck an almost perfect balance.My only complaint would be that the case does add some weight to the phone. However, it is unrealistic to achieve this amount of protection without adding a little size and a little weight. Spigen's Tough Armor case has set the bar for maximum protection with minimal bulk.

column9: Great case for where it protects, but not an all-in-one solution
column10: I came from an OtterBox for my iPhone 4s, and got this when upgrading to the 5s. It is a great fit, and doesn't move around. I like that it is comparatively thin, so it doesn't make the phone too bulky.  A few things are a little more exposed than I would like them to be, however.1. The apple symbol on the back of the phone is exposed. It is somewhat hidden by the inset provided by the case, but it could still get a little scratched and scuffed.2. The rear camera inset is well shaped, and appears to provide fair protection. I doubt this could be better without making the case exclusively for the 5s.3. The volume buttons are covered, and I haven't noticed any problem with activating them.4. the vibrate switch is also well protected, about as much as one could expect. It is exposed, but protected as well as could be hoped. If you have very big fingers, it may be difficult to access the switch.5. The power switch on the top is covered, and also doesn't seem to have any problems with it being covered.6. The holes for the speakers, the charger, and the headphones are nicely protected, though they are exposed. Again, I think the protection is as good as could be hoped.7. The front. This is the only area where I have a "problem" with the case. There is no screen protection, so an additional screen protector would need to be purchased and installed. An all-in-one solution would be preferred.  The case does provide a beveled edge, so the screen isn't sitting on the surface if you set it face-down. But, any drops or scrapes that don't hit this edge are completely unprotected.For where it protects, this case does an excellent job without making the phone overly bulky. An additional screen protector is required, but the case appears to to a great job otherwise.The sleek look enhances, rather than detracts from, the overall appearance of the phone, unlike many other cases.

column9: The perfect case (after a little work)
column10: I recently switched to his from the Otterbox Defender. I like the safety of a durable and reliable case. I found that this Spigen Tough Armor case offered great protection without the thickness of the Otterbox. It feels highly durable and looks very visually appealing. The gold case perfectly matches my gold iPhone 5S. The rubber on this case is very dense and almost feels like plastic unless you dig your fingernail into it. Because of this, it slides in and out of your pocket with no problem at all.Because the hard shell of this case is plastic, some slight scratching will occur. I am okay with this. it's better to scratch the case than the actual phone in my opinion. Having switched from an Otterbox Defender, I wanted the protection of a built in screen. I remedied this by buying a 3-pack of protection screens for only $5 on eBay. They fit perfectly within the case. The final thing I added was the clear plastic circle from my old Otterbox case. I taped it to the back of the case, so you open part with the Apple logo would not get scratched. I think Spigen left this part off to make the case more easily removable, but I would rather protect it better since I do not plan on removing it.Overall I would rate this case 4.5/5. This case offers most of the protection of an Otterbox, in a much thinner and better feeling design. I will definitely look back to Spigen for my future phone protection purchases.

column9: Great case with one major drawback (for me!)
column10: I got this case a couple of weeks ago for my iPhone 5 to replace the flexible TPU case I've been using so far.  Just wanted a little added protection without adding too much bulk.  In this aspect, the Spigen Tough Armor case excels.  It doesn't add too much bulk to the phone, keeps the look streamlined, and feels sturdy enough to protect the iPhone should I accidentally drop it from my hand.  Now, I don't think it offers the same level of protection as the Otterbox Defender does (as Spigen would like you to believe), especially for the screen, but that Otterbox is just too huge and cumbersome to use everyday.The Spigen case looks awesome too.  I got mine in Metal Slate, just to add a touch of color without being too obvious, and I've gotten a lot of compliments.  The buttons work perfectly, in fact the volume buttons are easier to use than without the case.  The lip around the screen is tall enough to prevent the screen from scratching if you place the phone screen down on any surface, but it does not look intrusive or add too much thickness to the phone.  The cutoff on the back for the camera/flash is large enough so that it will not mess with your pictures, and the logo cutoff adds some personality to the case.There's only one major drawback that some people may find unimportant, but it's a big deal for me.  I upgraded to the iPhone 5 from an iPhone 4 about a year ago.  Before upgrading, I had already bought several charging cables, docks, alarm clock, etc. to work with the iPhone 4.  In order to continue using these with the new lightning port on the iPhone 5, I bought the Apple Lightning to 30-Pin Adapter (original one from Apple).  The iPhone 5 looks funny in the docks, but at least I could continue using my old stuff, especially the alarm clock I use to charge my phone overnight.  However, because of the cutoffs on the bottom of the Spigen case, I can't use the adapter anymore, since it will not fully insert into the lightning port.  So I have to remove the case every night and replace it the next day.  Not much of a hassle, but I'm afraid the case will eventually break from installing and removing it so often.  On a positive note, all lightning cables, including the Amazon Basics one which is thicker than the original, fit perfectly.In short, if you don't have to worry about lightning to 30-pin adapters, this is probably the best case out there.  Stylish and protective without adding too much bulk.  Can't beat that!

column9: The best case I've ever owned
column10: (Disclaimer: I didn't purchase this case from Amazon, I had actually purchased it from SPIGEN's online store.)I have always been a fan of the less bulky cases for my iPhone, but after dropping my phone on the concrete one day and getting a shattered screen, I realized that I should look into something a little tougher.After some research (primarily on the Macrumors forums), I came across the SPIGEN Tough Armor case. It had everything I was looking for in a case: a slim design, able to withstand a couple drops with no damage and covers for the volume and hold buttons.I was skeptical at first, I mean the case is comparatively cheap to Otterbox, Lifeproof, etc; but after watching a couple review and test videos on YouTube, I was convinced. I placed the order for a black Tough Armor case along with a GLAS.tR on SPIGEN's website (not Amazon) and within a couple of days my stuff was at the door.1) First ObservationsThe packaging for this product is very well done. I was expecting something a little less "nice" for this price range, but SPIGEN did a really good job. You can tell SPIGEN has an attention to detail, nice job. The case itself is very solid, it has two "parts," a very strong black silicone/rubber-like material that is smooth to the tough and very hard but still slightly flexible to squeeze your case in and a second aluminum sheet that goes around the middle section of the case. This part appears to be anodized and has a matte finish. The buttons on the case have a very nice feel to them and are very large, so it appears to be easy to locate these buttons without looking at your phone.2) FitTo get the phone within the case, you need to first put in the left side with the volume buttons and silent switch, then you get the other side in. The case has a little flex to it, but this is a very snug fit. I have absolutely no reason to believe that this phone would fall out of the case. Visually, everything lines up perfectly. The silent switch (exposed) is perfectly in the center of the little "hole" that it is in and the speakers/lightning port and camera all line up perfectly. Even the apple logo in the back is centered perfectly. Overall, either I got incredibly lucky, or SPIGEN nailed the fit perfectly on these phones.3) DurabilityFinally, I can "plop" my phone on a table or accidently drop it anywhere without feeling worried. Seriously, I don't feel worried at all that my phone is going to be damaged within this case. I even test-dropped it 6 ft on the cement as soon as I got it (it was a little scary, but I did it) and nothing happened to the phone. I'm happy!4) (Bonus) GLAS.tRNow, the GLAS.tR is a separate product by SPIGEN, but it goes perfectly with this case. I'd highly recommend getting this product alongside with the Tough Armor case. I won't review the GLAS.tR here, but I will say that SPIGEN designed the Tough Armor case to fit with the GLAS.tR perfectly. My phone is 100% secured, front and back with the GLAS.tR and I have the case on as well.---UPDATE: 3 months of ownershipIt's been 3 months and it's going strong! I have dropped my phone numerous times and there are zero scuffs on the aluminum backplate and my phone looks great! I convinced my girlfriend to get one when she got her new 5S.I 100% recommend this case to anyone who doesn't need their case to be waterproof/dustproof and just needs something strong to protect their phone.

This case is awesome! I accidentally dropped it on the second day of having it on and the corner air pockets worked superbly and protected my phone. The case is not bulky either, keeping my iPhone 5s with a slim look.  And the price is not bad either. This is a must buy!
Best phone case I've ever had!  It has saved this phone countless times already.  Not to mention it's not too bulky so in my opinion it is already better than the Otterbox.

column9: Great cover, exactly what I was looking for!

This causes the case to not sit flat on any surfaces and I'm worried it could start to separate even more over time. I was planning to return it and ask for another, but I didn't want my phone to go without a case.
wish it had a face plate with it or a clear shield something to protect face but I really like the color it goes perfect with gold iphone

column9: Good case, though no screen cover
column10: Very light case, but surprisingly effective.  Note that there is no built-in screen covers with this case.  Still, it's a good value.

Awesome case, great design! Love the sleek look and def looks less bulky than otter case.  Def recommend this case

Great case. Got the 5s it seamless blends in with the phone. Dropped it a couple times already saved my life. It really works

Very nice case I love it and the screen protecter is good. Delivery was very fast and yes I would recommend it to a friend.
Elegant, well-designed, tough protective case that is not over-imposing or bulky.  Fits the IPhone like a glove and makes it look more complete.

Great case! Fits great and not too bulky yet not cheap and flimsy either. Just the right amount of protection!

I liked it very much, beautiful, practical, protects completely!!!  No case woulde be Best than this!!! It is the right one!

column9: Slim and it seems to work but doesn't fit 30 pin adaptor
column10: I like that this case has such a slim profile which makes it easy to place in my pocket and remove. It has survived (with my phone) a couple of small drops. I do find that I'm using my old dock less and less because of the inconvenience.
Excellent case for every day use. Sturdy, thin and quality built case. I love it. I would recommend it to my friends.

Simple. Slim. Tough. Cheap (price). I've already dropped my phone quite a few times, and this little case does it's job great. The only reason I gave it 4/5 stars is because the gap for the headphone jack is a little restrictive, and I usually have to pull the corner down to use it.
I love the sleakness and the feel of the case.  I love that the screen is protected by outer lip of the case and the apple sign shows on the back.  Excellent buy.
Just what I was looking for! Great case and good service! I would recommend it to everybody! Good price as well
Perfect fit and durable. Highly recommended and very good design. As expected from spigen the materials used and design are extra ordinary.

I wanted a case that offered maximum protection without ruining the sleek look of my new iPhone 5s. I have always used an Otterbox case, but never liked the bulk they add. I am very pleased with my purchase of this case. It snaps on with ease and I feel that my phone is protected against bumps and drops. I'm officially converted!

I would give them 0 stars if I could.Be aware - NO CUSOMER SUPPORT AT ALL!!!Case buttons don't have a haptic feedback.Don't kid yourself - this case doesn't provide protection comparable to Otterbox.After 1 drop case horribly scratched and ready for the trashcan.Save yourself some time and money - buy an Otterbox.

Love the case! dropped my phone a couple of times with no problems.  I wish the back had a protection over the apple sign I just cut something so it wouldn't get scratched, but still with that being said the case rocks.
Much slimmer than the otter box and can easily fit it my pocket.I have dropped it twice and so far it works great!
this is the best case i have purchased yet. absolutely no complaints. I would like to see more colors in the future but that's no big deal.
Great quality product!!!  Everything about this product is great.  The buttons have an awesome feel, the connector port is very easy to access, Very little bulk and feels great in your hand.

This is a well rounded case, the design and feel is great and it's not too bulky.  And after a few times of dropping my phone, I checked to see if there were any scratches on my phone after removing the case and there was none.

column9: Great Look, Sleek, and Confident it Will Protect
column10: Great protection, sleek look - exactly what I was looking for.  A word of warning...I have a Belkin docking cradle next to my bed.  The picture shows this case being completely open on the bottom - it actually has two "posts" connecting the two bottom pieces which block the lightning connector from going all the way in.  Rather than mess up the case (I had success on a previous case but didn't want to mess this one up) I whittled the plastic away on the sides of the connector in the docking cradle.  It fits now with the case on it.  So if you are getting this to dock your phone, it probably won't work without altering either the case of the cradle.  I also have a Zagg screen protector on my phone and I'm not a "phone dropper" as a rule, but after seeing the videos of the drop tests on line, I'm fairly certain this case will protect my phone in the event it slips out of my hand.
The case is super nice but for the fact that the back seems to be rubbing in areas. So the gold rubs off.
A tough case that still allows you to slide your phone into your pocket.  It is a very small profile and does not bulk up your phone.

column9: Great case...compliments phone, and offers great protection, barring Military use..!

Flat-out great case, good looks, and does job as advertised....I'd buy another one if first two EVER wear out.BTW -- I have the Space Grey 5s...and the case compliments well....almost like a second skin for the phone..!

This is a great phone case!  It's slim and compact but also feels durable. I think it will hold up for awhile. I often get compliments on it also. I definitely feel like my phone is protected. column9: Not as good as the Otterbox Defender, and more!

Despite having seen videos of phones "protected" by this case get rolled over by cars...dropped from great heights...etc. (all of which were posted by the company, of course), I learned the hard way that this case does not protect an iPhone screen when said iPhone is dropped onto the ground of a parking garage. However, I contacted Spigen a week ago to find out what type of warranty they provide for such damage given their grandiose claims.  I've heard nothing back.  At least tell me to go screw myself, but don't provide ZERO customer service.

The control buttons are easily accessible and work well.  The headphone port worked fine with my iphone headphones.  I haven't put it through the test of dropping it yet thankfully, but I think it would hold up well.

I've owned many phones over the last 10 years, as a result I've had several cases. I've had bulky ones, slim ones, cheap ones, expensive ones and everything in-between. I see many people with what seems to be more popular (otter), but I just can't see myself putting those types of cases on such a sleek phone and turning it into a huge heavy brick. This SPIGEN case protects the phone just fine while keeping a slim profile, there are some similar cases out there but in 2 pieces, this is a one piece and feels great.

This ia an excellent case. It looks good, feels strong, but keeps the footprint small and weighs little to nothing.

I bought this case for my new iPhone 5s. Ive had all 5 generations of the phone since the 3Gs and used cases with all of them.I'm a wood worker and frequently covered in dust. This is the first case I've had that keeps almost all dust off the phone. All previous cases have leaked enough that removing the phones from the cases, there'd be dust and dirt all over the inside of the case and the phone. The Spigen Tough Armor only leaks a minuscule amount at the bottom. It has a perfect fit at the edge of the screen. It fits exactly to the edge of the glass, without lipping onto the glass, forming a very tight seal. That leaves me wide open to use whatever screen protection I choose.There are other case options that would perhaps help with my specific dust issues. I get that. I don't however, care to increase the bulk of my phone to the proportions and weight of a brick.This case provides a great combination of good protection, a very comfortable to pocket and hold size, and a decent price.I wish it didn't have the circular cut out to show the Apple logo on the back of the device. It's just another place to catch dust. I know it's an iPhone, I really don't care if anyone else does.
Manufactured perfectly ! doesnt stick in your pocket, and feels like the phone. i recommend it 100 percent... my new fav case

column9: I like it but have one issue with the back
column10: Fits like a glove, seems like it offers the required protection I was looking for, and doesn't add a lot of bulk to the sleek 5s so I give a solid thumbs up for these attributes.  I like the look of it very much. I bought this to protect my new 5S. I previously had a 4S and it was outfitted with the Ballistic extremely heavy duty case (like Otterbox), which was also quite bulky. I wanted something that offered comparable protection but not nearly as large and thick. This appears to be a good alternative. It is well constructed and engineered. The manufacturing is very precise. It feels like it is good and solid, not like the cheap rubbery ones or the really hard plastic ones. I think for most normal handling and occasional drops or bumps of the phone this should be just fine. It is a 2 piece case that has the black plastic part that will wrap around your phone, and then you "snap" on the anodized part that fits like a precision piece of machinery. My only gripe, and why I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5, is that the anodized finish is not a bit more durable. I have only had this case for a couple of weeks and I am very careful with my phone, often to the point of being obsessive. It is either in my pocket, or safely sitting on a clean table, my desk at work, or the non-slip gel pad in my car or someplace like that. Despite my careful handling of the case/phone, it already has a scratch on the back. I don't know where it came from, but I know I have not dropped it or anything, maybe just had my keys in my pocket with the phone or something, although I usually avoid that as well. I hope it doesn't continue to get scratched this easily as I am really happy with the look of it otherwise, as well as the feeling that my phone does have good protection.
